name: Employment in each workforce and KTI industry, by sex, race or ethnicity, and nativity and citizenship: 2019
description: Employment in each workforce and KTI industry, by sex, race or ethnicity, and nativity and citizenship: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_race_or_ethnicity_not_underrepresented_minority
variableMeasured.description: Race Or Ethnicity Not Underrepresented Minority

variableMeasured.name: field_nativity_foreign_born_non_u_s_citizens
variableMeasured.description: Nativity Foreign Born Non U S Citizens

variableMeasured.name: field_nativity_foreign_born_u_s_citizens
variableMeasured.description: Nativity Foreign Born U S Citizens

notes: KTI industries include high R&D intensive and medium-high R&D intensive industries based on a classification by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. Data include workers ages 16–75 and exclude those in military occupations or currently enrolled in primary or secondary school. Values are rounded to the nearest thousand. Underrepresented minorities are Blacks or African Americans, Hispanics or Latinos, and American Indians or Alaska Natives.
sources: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey (ACS), 2019, Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS), accessed 12 December 2020.Science and Engineering Indicators
